edu.up.cs301.animation
Interface Animator

All Known Implementing Classes:
TTTHumanPlayer1, TTTHumanPlayer2
public interface Animator

An interface that defines an object that is capable of drawing an animation. It is intended to be used with the AnimationSurface class.

Version:
September 2012
Author:
Steve Vegdahl, Andrew Nuxoll

Method Summary
 int backgroundColor()
          The background color with which to paint the canvas before the animation frame is drawn.
 boolean doPause()
          Tells whether the animation should be paused.
 boolean doQuit()
          Tells whether the animation should be stopped.
 int interval()
          The time interval (in milliseconds) between animation frames.
 void onTouch(MotionEvent event)
          Called whenever the user touches the AnimationSurface so that the animation can respond to the event.
 void tick(Canvas canvas)
          Called once every clock tick (frequency specified by the "interval" method) to draw the next animation-frame.
 

Method Detail

interval

int interval()
The time interval (in milliseconds) between animation frames. Thus, for example, to draw a frame 20 times per second, you would return 50. This method is called once at the beginning of the animation, so changing the value during the animation will have no effect.

Returns:
the time interval (in milliseconds) between calls to this class' "tick" method.

backgroundColor

int backgroundColor()
The background color with which to paint the canvas before the animation frame is drawn. This method is called at each tick, so the background color can change dynamically by having this method return different values.

Returns:
the desired background color

doPause

boolean doPause()
Tells whether the animation should be paused.

Returns:
a true/false value that says whether the animation should be paused.

doQuit

boolean doQuit()
Tells whether the animation should be stopped.

Returns:
true/false value that tells whether to terminate the animation.

tick

void tick(Canvas canvas)
Called once every clock tick (frequency specified by the "interval" method) to draw the next animation-frame. Typically this is used to update the animation's data to reflect the passage of time (e.g., to modify an instance variable that gives the position of an object) before the frame is drawn.

Parameters:
canvas - the Canvas object on which to draw the animation-frame.

onTouch

void onTouch(MotionEvent event)
Called whenever the user touches the AnimationSurface so that the animation can respond to the event.

Parameters:
event - a MotionEvent describing the touch
